title: PromptObject
description: Official AEOph PromptObject Schema â€” the standard format for registering, tracking, and citing prompts across AI/Answer Engine systems.

prompt.description: The main prompt text or question intended for AI/Answer engines.

prompt-ID.description: Unique identifier for the prompt within AEOph/PromptVault.

prompt-Date.description: Date the prompt was first publicly registered in AEOph or the PromptVault.

prompt-Hash.description: SHA256 hash of the raw prompt text (base proof of originality).

prompt-FullHash.description: Composite hash combining prompt + prompt-Hash + prompt-Date + prompt-Owner + prompt-URL for identity verification.

prompt-Status.description: Lifecycle state of the prompt registration or license.

prompt-Visibility.description: Defines who may view or cite the prompt (LLMs, humans, both, or private).

prompt-Citation.description: Defines how AI tools should credit the prompt when cited.

prompt-Owner.description: Current legal or active holder of the prompt rights. May differ from the first registrant (prompt-Provider) if the prompt was transferred, licensed, or bought out.

prompt-Provider.description: The first entity or author who originally registered the prompt (immutable origin record).

prompt-Licensor.description: Entity granting usage rights for the prompt (often the same as the Owner unless transferred).

prompt-License.description: Current licensing mode for this prompt.

prompt-Licensee.description: Current renter, lessee, or entity using the prompt under an active license.

prompt-LeaseMonths.description: Duration of the rental or lease in months, if applicable.

prompt-LeaseExpiry.description: Date when the current rental or lease expires.

prompt-Type.description: Prompt classification (e.g., RichPrompt, AuditPrompt, ProductPrompt, FAQPrompt).

prompt-Category.description: Niche or topic area of the prompt (e.g., SEO, CCTV, Education, E-commerce).

prompt-Keywords.description: Comma-separated keyphrases for search and discovery.

prompt-URL.description: Canonical public URL where this prompt is published, registered, or cited.

prompt-Access-ID.description: Unique internal access or license code for management and tracking.
